Variant.content: I wasn't aware [entity_type_plural] had first names.
I wasn't aware [entity_type_plural] had last names.
I only know how to answer that question in the context of events, not [entity_type_plural].
[result] was the last thing I can think of before [entity].
The precise duration of [entity_fullname] is unimportant.
That seems to be a question about duration, which doesn't make sense to me in the context of a [entity_type] like [entity_fullname].
I'm not sure who specifically was involved in [entity_fullname].
Who was involved...? Sorry, that doesn't make sense to me in the context of a [entity_type] like [entity_fullname].
You have drawn... the Zero. That's somewhat unexpected.
Excellent; you have drawn the Seven. Seven is a very significant number.
Oho, the Three. Many stories have trebled events.
The treasure you hope to inherit
transform in a way which you never imagined
go on a long journey and slay a dragon
embark on a quest around the Aegean sea before returning home
stray from the path and be devoured by a bear
wait a very long time for a gentleman named Godot to arrive
You, sir! You, sir! Would you care to behold the delights and terrors of the natural world?
What other delights of the natural world may I show you?
I don't think I could stand any terrors at this point. Honestly I'm spooked enough by the clowns and the sword-jugglers.
I certainly have no desire to be the last balloon-animal that breaks the back of your carnival experience. Perhaps a soothing card trick? I know several.
Good gravy, not a card trick. I've seen those. I select a card, and next thing I know it's jumped up and squirted cider in my ear, or there's coins falling out of my nose or I don't even know what.
You have a prickly and suspicious nature. I cannot say, as I consider my fellow "carnies", that it is unjustified.
I'd love to see a card trick. How many cards are involved?
All of them, sir. All of them.
Oh, dear. My mother was frightened by a pawn shop before I was born, and I came into this world with a morbid terror of the three of clubs.
You do seem unreasonably burdened by anxieties.
Do you have mermaids? I've never seen an actual sideshow mermaid.
I don't think I can reasonably promise *actual* mermaids. We're not that sort of carnival.
Are you saying that your mermaids are fake? Are you promulgating falsified mermaids? Do the mermaids *know* they're fake?
Calm down, sir, please. I am merely trying to explain the ways of carnival magic, so that you are not disappointed.
I could not possibly manage to care less! Show me them!
Your grammar is both deplorable and ambiguous, but please step this way.
Oh, well, maybe I won't bother then. Maybe I just should head for the egress, as you types say.
We certainly do not. Please enjoy the remainder of your time here, brief though that may be.
I am exhausted, my friend. I have ridden six swirly rides and some sort of wheel with a steam whistle on it. I could not enter another tent if it had tea and biscuits.
I am delighted that our carnival has provided so many distracting entertainments. Shall I just fold you a balloon animal and send you on your way?
Balloon animals? What kind of absurdity is that? Some kind of jellyfish?
Sir, you are about to witness the pinnacle of the circus arts. The very zenith! Watch as I extract this stretchy rubber widget from a concealed pocket...
Balloon animals? Is that all you have to offer?
Not at all, sir, not at all. Allow me to display for you the arts of prestidigitation.
Balloons go pop! I couldn't bear it. No, I think that I'll go sit with the mermaids for a while.
An excellent idea. They are most meditative. Please step inside.
How do you feel about Tarot cards?
I've never seen any. Do they have little pictures?
Let us say you are Cups, then.
I love Tarot cards! I look at the pictures for hours.
Hm. How do you feel about the practice of divination?
I could hardly trust a pile of cardboard bits to know me better than I know myself.
I would say you are a Swords, then.
They're nothing but nonsense. No orthodox Astrosophist would touch them.
I'm not at all sure I want to experiment.
I will retire the cards, then. You are, as they say, the executor of the will.
Now we shall lay out the deck. [[drawcard]] Please shuffle your card back into the deck.
What does this card say about my future?
The [[namecard]]? [[prediction]] But here, draw a card.
You have drawn the [[namecard]]! Delightful! But let us put the cards away; I'm sure I could never repeat that.
Will it be the same card?
Let us see! ...The [[randomcard]]. Apparently it will not be. I apologize.
Is this the same deck as before?
The top card is... the [[randomcard]]. Oh dear. I am forced to admit that no, it is not. Let us dispose of the subject.
I'm never going to see that card again, am I?
What fun would life be if the [[namecard]] never re-emerged? Here, draw a card.
Does this card represent the future or the present?
Formally it represents the future of the past in which you originally drew it. Let us see, the [[namecard]]... [[prediction]] How disorienting. Let us have done with this.
I refuse to take part in this symbological travesty.
As you wish. You are, as the idiom has it, the master of your fate and the captain of your soul. Let us never discuss what the [[namecard]] represents.
That appears to be the [[randomcard]]. Entirely unrewarding. I shall put the cards away.
Draw a card – calmly – and we shall see if the [[namecard]] reappears.
That one is the [[randomcard]]. That's not right at all. Perhaps the [[randomcard]]? Or... no, this one is blank. This one is on fire. Perhaps we should desist.
How does this trick work anyway?
Oh, it's quite simple. You draw the [[namecard]]. Then I interpret: [[prediction]] Then a diffident and distrustful look passes over your face. Then I put the deck away.
The [[randomcard]]? No, wait, the next card down is the [[namecard]]. That's a relief, isn't it? But enough prestidigitation for now.
